metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40897 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Python Packaging Authority (PyPA) setuptools before 65.5.1 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service via HTML in a crafted package orcustom PackageIndex page. There is a Regular Expression Denial of Service(ReDoS) in package_index.py.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40897` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pypy-pkg-resources - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1
pypy-setuptools - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1
python-pkg-resources - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1
python-setuptools - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1
python3-pkg-resources - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1
python3-setuptools - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

python-pip - 9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.6
python-pip-whl - 9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.6
python3-pip - 9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-setuptools package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1').
python-pip package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.6').
